member.summary: Useful extensions for .

member.name: M:Json.Path.JsonNodeExtensions.TryGetValue``1(System.Text.Json.Nodes.JsonNode,``0@)
member.summary: Extends to the base class.
member.param: The node that may contain the value.
The value if successful; null otherwise.
member.returns: True if successful; false otherwise.

member.name: M:Json.Path.JsonNodeExtensions.TryGetSingleValue(System.Text.Json.Nodes.JsonNode)
member.summary: Ensures a only represents a single value.
member.returns:
Within the context of this library, a may be stored inside a . Some operations, such as expression addition, require that a single value is provided.
This method checks to see if the underlying value of a `JsonNode` is a `NodeList`. If not, it simply returns the JsonNode. If the underlying value is a `NodeList` _and_ the it only contains a single value, it returns that value. Otherwise, it returns null.
member.remarks: Though a bit complex, this method can be very important for functions that require single values as inputs rather than nodelists since function composition is possible (e.g. `min(max(@,0),10)`) and functions return nodelists.

member.name: M:Json.Path.JsonNodeExtensions.TryGetSingleValue(Json.Path.NodeList)
member.summary: Ensures a only represents a single value.
member.returns:
Within the context of this library, a may be stored inside a . Some operations, such as expression addition, require that a single value is provided.
This method checks to see if the underlying value of a `JsonNode` is a `NodeList`. If not, it simply returns the JsonNode. If the underlying value is a `NodeList` _and_ the it only contains a single value, it returns that value. Otherwise, it returns null.
member.remarks: Though a bit complex, this method can be very important for functions that require single values as inputs rather than nodelists since function composition is possible (e.g. `min(max(@,0),10)`) and functions return nodelists.

member.name: T:Json.Path.JsonPath
member.summary: Represents a JSON Path.

member.name: P:Json.Path.JsonPath.Root
member.summary: Gets a JSON Path with only a global root and no selectors, namely `$`.

member.name: P:Json.Path.JsonPath.Scope
member.summary: Gets the scope of the path.

member.name: P:Json.Path.JsonPath.IsSingular
member.summary: Gets whether the path is a singular path. That is, it can only return a nodelist containing at most a single value.
member.remarks:
A singular path can only contain segments which must meet all of the following conditions:
- is not a recursive descent (`..`) - contains a single selector - that selector is either an index selector or a name selector
For example, `$['foo'][1]` is a singular path. Shorthand syntax (e.g. `$.foo[1]`) is also allowed.

member.name: P:Json.Path.JsonPath.Segments
member.summary: Gets the segments of the path.

member.summary: Parses a from a string.
member.returns: The parsed path.
member.exception: Thrown if a syntax error occurred.

member.summary: Parses a from a string.
member.param: The parsed path, if successful; otherwise null.
member.returns: True if successful; otherwise false.

member.summary: Evaluates the path against a JSON instance.
member.param: The root of the JSON instance.
member.returns: The results of the evaluation.

member.name: T:Json.Path.PathEvaluationOptions
member.summary: Provides a number of options to be used during evaluation.

member.name: T:Json.Path.PathParseException
member.summary: Thrown when an error occurs attempting to parse a JSON Path.

member.name: P:Json.Path.PathParseException.Index
member.summary: The index at which the error occurred.

member.name: T:Json.Path.PathParsingOptions
member.summary: Defines a set of configuration options to control parsing behavior.

member.name: P:Json.Path.PathParsingOptions.AllowMathOperations
member.summary: Gets or sets whether mathematical operators are allowed.
member.remarks: These operators are an extension of the specification, so they are disallowed by default.

member.name: P:Json.Path.PathParsingOptions.AllowRelativePathStart
member.summary: Gets or sets whether a JSON Path can start with the `@` symbol instead of `$`.

member.name: P:Json.Path.PathParsingOptions.AllowJsonConstructs
member.summary: Gets or sets whether JSON objects and arrays (double-quotes only) are permitted in expression syntax.
member.remarks: Per the specification, only numbers, strings, `null`, `true`, and `false` are permitted.

member.name: P:Json.Path.PathParsingOptions.TolerateExtraWhitespace
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the JSON Path can contain whitespace in places the spec says it shouldn't, e.g. between a function name and the opening parenthesis.
member.remarks: Per the specification, leading or trailing whitespace is also forbidden. Enabling this option permits this.

member.name: P:Json.Path.PathParsingOptions.AllowInOperator
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the `in` operator is allowed.
member.remarks:
These operators are an extension of the specification, so they are disallowed by default.
May also require that be set to `true` so that array and object literals are also permitted.

member.name: T:Json.Path.PathResult
member.summary: The results of a JSON Path evaluation against a JSON instance.

member.name: P:Json.Path.PathResult.Matches
member.summary: The list of matches.

member.name: P:Json.Path.PathResult.Error
member.summary: An error, if any, that occurred during evaluation.

member.name: T:Json.Path.PathScope
member.summary: Indicates the scope of a path.

member.name: F:Json.Path.PathScope.Global
member.summary: The scope is the entire JSON document. These paths start with `$`.

member.name: F:Json.Path.PathScope.Local
member.summary: The scope is the local JSON value. These paths start with `@`.

member.name: P:Json.Path.PathSegment.IsRecursive
member.summary: Indicates whether the segment is evaluated as a recursive descent operation.

member.name: P:Json.Path.PathSegment.IsShorthand
member.summary: Indicates whether the segment is represented in its shorthand form (e.g. `.foo` instead of `['foo']`).
